transcript.text: I used to take the train by myself to
New York and spend the day walking
around Anarchist bookstores and my
parents didn't know that was I grew up
in Canada but it was still the same for
me in Toronto I used to take the subway
car down basball game we moved into the
suburbs when my kids were little can't
imagine a place that's more safe kids
were playing in the streets they'd go
into each other's houses and so on you
go to the same neighborhood now you
don't see a child either they're inside
looking at video games or they're being
driven somewhere for organized
activities kids it's been in fact study
children don't know how to play
spontaneously everything has to be
controlled they have to be watched all
the time
